solution.text:
As AB is tangent the to the circle
line OC joining the centre to point C is perpendicular to AB
Also the length of OC=radius=_{{4*k}}_ and OD is _{{k*5}}_
therefore a right-angle triangle(OCD) is formed
By Pythagoras theorem we can find CD
\(CD=\sqrt {OD^2-OC^2}=\sqrt {_{{5*k}}_^2-_{{4*k}}_^2}\)
\(\Rightarrow CD =_{{3*k}}_\)
and _{j}_\(\times\)CD=_{{j*3*k}}_

content.text:
Line AB is tangent to a circle of radius=_{{k*4}}_cm at point C.
Another line passing through the centre O cuts the line AB at D such that OD is _{{k*5}}_.
Find the value of _{j}_*CD
